III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Seclusion within secure and nonsecure facilities; seclusion plan;
Title prohibitions; reduction and elimination
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4162
Section (11) All seclusion will be prohibited effective November 1, 2022.
Description
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Facility is secluding youth
Investigation Interviews:
On 12/12/2024 a video conference was held. Area manager,
Manager 1, Manager 2 and Manager 3 participated. Agency staff
confirmed that youth were being secluded in their bedrooms at
night. Clarification of the rule was provided to the agency
regarding seclusion and how securing bedrooms at night is in
violation of that rule. The agency indicated their intention to
submit a plan on their process to come into compliance with the
rule.
On 12/17/2024 in-person interviews were completed with Youth
F, Youth D and Youth G at Vista Maria. All three youth confirmed
that the bedroom doors are locked when they are in their rooms
for the night to sleep. They reported that they are required to
knock on the door if they need to exit to use the restroom or for
any other needs.
On 12/17/2024 an in-person interview was completed with
Compliance at Vista Maria. He confirmed that bedroom doors
are secure at night in Beata, Freedom and Rose Hall.
On 12/17/2024 an in-person interview was completed with Staff 1.
She confirmed that bedroom doors are secure at night when youth
go to bed.
On 01/08/2025 an in-person interview was held with Youth A.
She confirmed that bedroom doors are still being locked at night.
Documents Reviewed:
Vista Maria Sleeping Room Hour Policy – Policy indicates in
order to meet the standards of Public Act 116 (PA 116) and
provide all residents with appropriate healthy sleeping habits,
Vista Maria has set hours for sleeping that shall not exceed the
resident being in their bedrooms more than 8 hours for sleeping.
Residents may request to stay in their rooms longer, but should
not be required. Residents are to observe sleeping hours between
the following hours of 11pm -7am. During which time the bedroom
doors are to be secured.
Email Documentation - The agency provided documentation
from a prior consultant that advised that the agency could, for the
2

purposes of safety, continue to lock the bedrooms of youth during
sleeping hours.
Agency Compliance Plan – A plan was submitted by Vista
administration that indicated bedrooms would be unlocked during
sleeping hours by 1/31/25.
Tour of Facility:
A tour of the facility bedroom area was completed on 12/17/2024.
Some bedroom doors of youth bedrooms were found to be
unsecure and other were found to be secured. At the time of the
tour, youth were not in their bedrooms. No other areas of concern
were noted.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, it was determined that the
agency was locking the doors of the bedrooms of the youth at the
facility. Although seclusion is prohibited by the rule, the agency
will not be found in non-compliance based on incorrect
consultation provided previously.
Technical Assistance
Agency was informed they are required to eliminate the use of
seclusion during sleeping hours.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
